info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:58AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Garfield...western Wayne...southwestern Emery and southeastern Sevier Counties through 545 AM MDT... At 455 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 9 miles southwest of Teasdale, or 21 miles west of Capitol Reef National Park, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated and mesonet confirmed. A gust of 48 mph was recorded at Bryce Canyon Airport at 400 AM MDT. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Capitol Reef National Park, Bicknell, Torrey, Teasdale, Caineville and Fruita. This includes the following highways... Utah Route 12 between mile markers 95 and 122. Utah Route 24 between mile markers 59 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
